intro: Sabazia palmeri, commonly known as the desert sage, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its gray-green, narrow leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand extreme heat and drought. Its botanical features make it well-suited for xeriscaping and ecological restoration in desert environments.
